reviews.review_msg: But honestly, shes very pretty=
dont take
sure
Sometimes She doesn't explain things well. If you're taking class with her, you better study the ppt and watch some coding on youtube. \
So strict

She doesn't explain the theory behind each code she just goes through roughly, but I am a fxxking rookie!! and this makes my learning very difficult. DO NOT TAKE HER!!!  It is a waste of money, sleep, brain and time.  Finally, if you ask her a question, it is better a small issue. otherwise she will mock you with her eyes.
Do not asking question if you don't want to be in her black list.

Never take this teacher 
Worst
never take this prof
i will not recommend taking this class with her.

Started this course with no background in programming. I just listened to every word she said, went to every lecture, did every homework and even found some programming projects on my own. Please, read the chapters before coming to class and ask questions. Thank you Jiang Ye!
I made a few fake reviews back in august so that i could take 135 with yonas
Follow her advices and you will learn a lot. They did a great job for first year computer science courses.
I contacted her about reviewing my final exam and grades, and she changed my grade up from c- to c+ after finding her own mistake. I think she give grade fairly.
Will give you grade u deserve

She is nice prof. She helps people out and is funny. She has really inspired me to learn more about coding and I will not have got this grade without her. Professor Jiang, thank you, for the help, for the challenge, for the inspiration. Take her and you will not regret!

She is very strict with coding style format and all, she is good if you are really good at coding, she don't explain she just revise and this makes it difficult for new coders I would HIGHLY NOT RECOMMEND her it's just waste of money and time.If you do not do well or fail in first quiz, you wouldn't pass any other quiz. Please don't take her.

I wouldn't recommend her, she is very strict regarding coding style, and her teaching skills are low, according to her 80% of the class fails which you will very well understand after taking her class. She deducts marks for small mistakes, even though your code is running and the logic is correct.

Very awful communication. Her homework and exams are not difficult, but there are a lot of strange requirements (though it may seem useless) like coding style and format. Failure to comply with these requirements will result a low grade of your work.
Jiang's much better in those in-person classes, don't choose Yonas who has much much more homework than jiang trust me don't even think about yonas

She is unnecessarily strict. Even if you do the whole coding and make a simple mistake, she will grade you 1 or 2 out of 25 or 30 marks. I do not suggest anyone new to computer science take her course. If you already know how to code, you could take her course. She does not inspire the students to work harder.

If you never knew anything, ANYTHING about c++, I suggest you not to take this yet. Her teaching isn't good enough! Bad explanation and too strict on codings. I can barely catch up to her lecture so I used Youtube to get good grades instead.

Once you don't do well in the first two quizzes you can't pass any other. would believe you cheated in the rest and upgrade world you get full marks in. tough grader cant explain her work and gives what she cant solve. don't take if you have never coded before. I have a good coding background and still got a d. Got an A in with the next instructor.
Probably the worst professor i have studied under. No sense of communication. Toughest examinations.

Ive coded since High school and I even made an app for my friends. This class is just a basic class but prof make it hard. She didnt explain well plus when you ask question she is angry about that. Friendly advice: Dont take her class tough grader plus cannot explain well.
exams are much tougher than work done in class and there is so much chance you'll repeat the course

Very tough grader. If the code working but the output wrong, she will mark you nearly zero. If the code output right and the logic didn't satisfy her. She will half your grade. This is my second time taking it and I don't even know If I can make it through this I feel hopeless because of the way she grading. I tried so hard. She doesn't effort.

do not doubt yourself, because you are right !!!! she really does not know how to teach, i study by myself for whole semester. and hard to communicate!!!! run away as fast as you can! unless you want to waste your money!!!
RUN AWAY AS SOON AS POSSIBLE !!!! Do not choose her class, so terrible.

Bad in English, Hard to communicate. I have started writing program since secondary, she makes every hard, and she is so stubborn that you must follow her rules. She doesn't even let us use float data type.
Wost prof I ever had. Avoid her at ALL costs.

I have been coding since before high school so this course should have been a cakewalk, but she made it difficult. For example, according to her 2.4 is not a float data type, it is only double. Her coding knowledge is very limited and she will not accept anything other than what she knows. NOT AT ALL RECOMMENDED!

She is the weirdest kind of human on this planet. she is a racist and has a language problem as being from China. you could not really understand her. there is a lot of communication gap. please don't waste your semester and money with her.
She is really caring to her students .

Honestly shes alright, if you put in a bit of work you'll get a good mark. She has a little difficulty explaining concepts clearly and she doesn't like to repeat herself especially if she explained it in detail already but gives A LOT of feedback on your work. Does teach you good coding style - useful in future

Recommend to have some basic knowledge of C++, it's really easy in Week 1&2, but it'll be different after that. She got a heavy accent, need some time to get used to it. Her voice may be aggressive sometimes and may misunderstand your question. But she would still try to explain it, so I still encourage u to ask. And don't copy the codes.

First of all, I know that most students find it hard to understand what she's saying. I agree with that. That is why she gives us the textbook to read. The way she teach is not enough for me to understand. However, the way she grade and show me where I got my question wrong is a big thumbs up.

Worst instructor I've had so far. I think she's good at C++ herself but has a hard time explaining things clearly to the class. Get ready to do a lot of reading by yourself cuz her lectures won't help. Attendance is important and she expects you to code like a pro even at a beginner programming course like CMPT130. Avoid taking her class if you can

The worst prof ever. Doesn't teach anything properly. I got 70% in the midterm and still failed the final and the course. Because she doesn't teach and if you ask her questions she shouts at you rather than explaining.

Worst Teacher Ever !!!!! I swear if reading out from the notes and not explaining anything at all was the only qualification required to become a teacher , i could teach the whole class better than her. She should Retire early. If your dad has a lot of money then go for Jiang Ye , else Mr . Yonas is the best CMPT130 teacher to go for.
Just don't, trust me. I believe she does not know what she is teaching...
Good professor.
good teacher
good, youll get a decent grade if you did all exercises.
if you work hard, you will get a great mark

She might know how to code but has no idea how to explain it to the students whatsoever. Her explanations don't make sense. She lacks what it takes to explain a concept to someone. And you're fricked if you have doubts because she doesn't take them.
WORST TEACHER EVER
Helpful
She is so inspirational and always help you to get your goal in life as well as very helpful inside and outside the class.
She is the best prof. that I ever took in my life. I really want to take more classes with her.

I can say that i have never given a prof a bad score. I am in SFU and we are going through OOP again. The only thing i will say to you is that she is an incompetent teacher and person. Do not take her class if possible, if you do, do not confuse yourself with her classes just read the book and online sources so that you can learn.

If you can take other prof's cmpt classes, please do not think about her. Her exercise is very little and useless for the tests and exams. And I think she do not know when should teach what, she just give everything without ordered. if you are taking the course for first time, you will not understand what she is talking about.
She is very knowledgeable but she doesn't have a grading criteria and sucks at teaching. If you can avoid, don't take her class.
Tough exams :(
jut don't take her course, it will make you having headache

She's a great teacher. I appreciate her teaching on indenting and coding habits. They help you produce better quality codes. And guys, you need to read the book more and do more practice if you hope to get good in coding. No one can hold your hands and guide you step by step in university. You'll realize it the more programming courses you take.
she always said" you should read!!!" but never tell you what the problem of your code, and also yeil that" your codes are very wrong."
She is knowledgeable but she yells at students when ask questions. Not patient at all. Expects you to get everything in the first time and does not answer any questions. Im afraid of her.

Now One thing you need to know is that Jiang Ye is not going to baby you to pass her course. You are in University not High School. You need to listen and PAY ATTENTION. ALWAYS Ask questions. She only gets frustrated, when she has to re-explain something to those PARTICUlAR students who werent listening or paying attention. She is a great Prof
Worst prof i have had yet . I dont know how she has become a teacher

decent teacher. she is helpful. But this is a difficult course. Don't skip class or it will be extremely hard to catch up because she didn't provide much info on her lecture notes. you gotta read not only one but other books about computer design and that help you understand her lecture. if you can't, drop it or cmpt250 will let you down
Tbh I think she's ok. Don't really understand why all the hate. If you do well on her occasional tests, chances are you'll do well on the final.

She seems alright, a little tough on the grading but squeezes out the bad students. Give really good feedback. Study well and you'll do great. Uses sarcasm sometimes lmao. Funny if your first language is english or if you're really good in english. Has a lil broken english but was more then understandable for me. :) Overall would take herclassagain

Course material isn't that hard and she's really helpful and explains well enough. It's just that her midterm and quizzes take a long time to do and you're very short on time. And she's pretty harsh on the marking too. I managed to get an A+ though.
I don't know why I just got so low grade, before final I have still 78%, and the 2nd assignment is not clear in the description..
Avoid her she likes making the course more difficult then it actually is. Avoid her at no cost!!!
very bad. she doesn't know how to teach. I feel sorry for you if you have to take her class. she makes everything complicated than it should be.
Awful prof!! Haven't seen a prof so bad as her.Sadistic Woman, loves to scream on students.
